title: [ONNX] Exporting Cast operation with wrong input types
body_html:
Issue description

I am trying to export a PyTorch model to ONNX which contains the Cast operation. When I try to run the ONNX checker on the exported model, I get an error on the cast function:

ValidationError: Attribute 'to' is expected to have field 's'

==> Context: Bad node spec: input: "14" output: "15" op_type: "Cast" attribute { name: "to" i: 7 type: INT }

Apparently, the export is using the enum number for the operation instead of its string, which is what the checker expects.

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+21e0fc8
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.11.0

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] Could not collect

body:
## Issue description

I am trying to export a PyTorch model to ONNX which contains the Cast operation. When I try to run the ONNX checker on the exported model, I get an error on the cast function:

```
ValidationError: Attribute 'to' is expected to have field 's'

==> Context: Bad node spec: input: "14" output: "15" op_type: "Cast" attribute { name: "to" i: 7 type: INT } 

```

Apparently, the export is using the enum number for the operation instead of its string, which is what the checker expects.

## System Info
PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+21e0fc8
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.11.0

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA
